ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained further skills in speaking, listening and writing in Modern Chinese through constant practice. I also gained a new understanding of Asian American history and culture in Modern China.

I learned a deep understanding of Chinese culture and the language itself. Helping me to better understand and digest my experiences when I was living in Beijing. I learned how to express myself more greatly in speaking, how to write at a higher caliber, and how to appreciate Chinese more.

Throughout the course of the semester, I've grown a lot in my knowledge of Chinese vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation. Talking in Chinese everyday and practicing grammar rules have really helped my conversational speaking abilities and ability to speak more spontaneously. I've really enjoyed my time in this class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strength: Sun Laoshi is the kindest soul I have ever met. She truly loves her students and her job. She has fostered such a strong class community. I could not imagine my first year without her.

This class was incredibly proficient at teaching the intricate grammar of Chinese and the various skills needed to succeed in learning Chinese. By interacting with the professor face to face and having to speak Chinese every single day, proficiency was built up through practice. The assignments were also geared towards learning and were not overbearing.

I believe the course overall is setup perfectly for the goal- one day asynchronous is definitely a good arrangement so that youre not always worrying about the daily character quiz and so that you have a little bit of time to sleep in after a week of 9am classes, which is much needed. But overall the structure is kind of perfect.

I think that one of my weaknesses in the class is pronouncing certain words incorrectly because of the old habits I've been used to when speaking. I believe that the more I practice speaking and being more intentional about my tones and word choice would help aid my speaking abilities.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes especially with sun lao shi

I would definitely recommend this course as a continuation to Chinese at Yale. The professors are incredible and teach this class very well. The workload is not too overbearing either and serves as a good way to practice language skills.
I would definitely encourage any student in the heritage track to at least complete 122 if anything else.

I would definitely recommend this course to other students. The community you have, the support given to you, and the family you make through class everyday is really something special. The Chinese teachers at Yale are some of the most wonderful, kind, and generous people you'll meet.
